snippet: A spokeswoman for the automaker apologized for sponsoring a cold front that ultimately was faulted for the deaths of dozens of people in much of Europe.
abstract: A spokeswoman for the automaker apologized for sponsoring a cold front that ultimately was faulted for the deaths of dozens of people in much of Europe.
lead_paragraph: To promote its Mini subsidiary, BMW paid the Institute of Meteorology at Berlin's Free University to name the cold front Cooper, a model designation within the Mini brand. Such sponsorships through the institute are common -- but the weather system has left significant snowfall in Central and Eastern Europe and has been faulted for the deaths of dozens of people, primarily in Poland. Read more »

headline.main: BMW Apologizes for Sponsorship of Deadly European Cold Front
